titlestmt.titleproper: Broadcast Center Recordings, circa 1980-2017 : Finding Aid AC362
titlestmt.author: Annalise Berdini

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 12:36:38 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid content adheres to that prescribed by Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Princeton University. Office of Information Technology. Broadcast Center.

did.abstract: The Broadcast Center operates a full TV/audio production studio and supports recording of events, classes, and interviews at the studio and on campus. The collection includes over 2,300 video recordings of Princeton-related lectures, conferences, symposia, events, ceremonies and creative works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes over 2,300 video recordings of Princeton-related lectures, conferences, symposia, events, ceremonies and creative works. These recordings feature a variety of speakers, including politicians, celebrities, and activists, as well as scholars and professors from Princeton and around the world. Topics include religion, finance, gender, technology, philosophy, science, sports, and other issues. Also included is a series of Campus Shots, which capture daily life at Princeton, documenting various activities on campus.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Access to recordings follows Mudd Manuscript Library policy for preservation and access to audiovisual materials. This collection contains both analog and digital collections.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. For quotations that are fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law , no permission to cite or publish is required. The Trustees of Princeton University hold copyright to all materials generated by Princeton University employees in the course of their work. If copyright is held by Princeton University, researchers will not need to obtain permission, complete any forms, or receive a letter to move forward with non-commercial use of materials from the Mudd Library. For materials where the copyright is not held by the University, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold the copyright and obtaining approval from them. If you have a question about who owns the copyright for an item, you may request clarification by contacting us through the Ask Us! form.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: No materials were separated from this collection during processing in 2016 or 2019. No prior information about appraisal is available.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The born-digital materials in this collection have been processed according to Princeton University Library's Born-Digital Processing Workflows. For more information on the workflow, please read our full Born-Digital Processing Information Note .

This finding aid was updated and split into series by Lynn Durgin in December 2017. Information about prior processing is not available. This finding aid was updated in November 2019 by Annalise Berdini .

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); (Collection Title), Box and Folder Number; Special Collections, Princeton University Library.

bioghist.note: Princeton University. Office of Information Technology. Broadcast Center.
bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Broadcast Center operates a full TV/audio production studio and supports recording of events, classes, and interviews at the studio and on campus. Previous to its establishement in 2008, Media Services performed this role. Established in 1984, Media Services expanded on the responsibilities of the Audio-Visual Center.

controlaccess.subject: Rites and ceremonies -- New Jersey -- Princeton.
Education, Higher -- New Jersey.
controlaccess.corpname: Princeton University. Office of Information Technology. Broadcast Center.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes video recordings of Princeton-related lectures, conferences, symposia, events, ceremonies and creative works. The media that these videos were stored on did not indicate the date of recording.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: No arrangement scheme has been imposed on this series.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use.
